results.title: Close encounters of the sexual kind
results.brief_description: Sequel to “Contraception: ready or not” addressing myths, facts and attitudes towards sexually transmitted diseases. Designed to encourage a responsible attitude towards sex, contraception and the prevention of STD’s. The issues raised include AIDS, the need for medical check-ups, communication and condoms.
results.description: Sequel to “Contraception: ready or not” addressing myths, facts and attitudes towards sexually transmitted diseases. results.title: Royal Australian Navy 75 Years
results.creator_credit: Stafford Garner, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Stafford Garner and Associates
results.brief_description: Since the days of the First Fleet, Australia has been inevitably dependent on the sea - first for much needed supplies, later for trade. As Australia’s wealth was recognised and trade increased, the question of the country’s defence became more important, making the establishment of a Navy vital, and in 1911, the RAN came into being. An archival compilation narrated by Ronald Coleby.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stafford Garner, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Stafford Garner and Associates

results.title: Remembering Life
results.brief_description: A history of Life magazine which first appeared in America in November 1936. Life pioneered pictorial journalism and in the process radically altered the course of the print media. Editors, journalists and photographers involved with its production, discuss the incredible power and influence had by this pictorial.

results.title: Dream house
results.creator_credit: Sally Pryor and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A dream in which the dreamer imagines she can travel into her own brain using computer animation. This brain has a structure like a house, with each room containing images of personality and personal experience.

results.title: Introduction to Microwave Cookery
results.brief_description: Virginia Hill presents a videotape that will take the mystery out of microwave cooking. Microwave cooking is easy, nutritious and fun when you know how. This tape takes the viewer through a step-by-step guide to the microwave oven and its effective use.
results.description: Virginia Hill presents a videotape that will take the mystery out of microwave cooking. Microwave cooking is easy, nutritious and fun when you know how. This tape takes the viewer through a step-by-step guide to the microwave oven and its effective use.

results.title: Las Madres de Plaza de Mayo
results.brief_description: A compelling documentary account of the protests organised by the mothers of 30,000 people who disappeared in Argentina during the wave of kidnapping, tortures and murders initiated by the military junta during the 1970s. Winner of 17 International Awards.
results.description: A compelling documentary account of the protests organised by the mothers of 30,000 people who disappeared in Argentina during the wave of kidnapping, tortures and murders initiated by the military junta during the 1970s. Winner of 17 International Awards.

results.title: Wildlife of the River Valley
results.brief_description: A program that presents a unique view of the enormous variety of wildlife that lives in the Bellinger River Valley, situated halfway between Sydney and Brisbane on the east coast of Australia. This is a brightly paced, entertaining and informative documentary that can be enjoyed by audiences of all ages.

results.title: Joshua Cooks & Dragon
results.creator_credit: Lucy MacLaren, Penny Robenstone and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Through making a cake, a little boy gains some sense of independence and growth. Within this he struggles with fantasy versus reality to achieve an end product he can be proud of. Plus the story of two young girls who leave a dragon on a tram and go to the depot at night to find it.

results.title: The Fogbrook Thing
results.creator_credit: Mark Osborne and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Set in the mid-Sixties, this film accompanies Peter Young on his first camping trip with the Boy Scouts - deep into the bush, into a place of myths and folklore and fearful adventures. (ATOM Award 1987).

results.title: The Huge Adventures of Trevor a Cat/Foxbat and the Mimi
results.creator_credit: John Skibinski, John Taylor and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: The hilarious story of a cat, whose hunting instincts are accidentally over-revived, plus the story of a flying fox which takes shelter in a cave, something he regrets when cave spirits attempt to capture him. Rated: G
